section.title: 3The Lindeberg condition, the Lyapunov condition, the Feller condition, and asymptotic negligibility

para.p:
Let
( Ω , F , P )
be a probability and let
X n

≥ n 1

L 2
random variables. We specify when we impose other hypotheses on them; in particular, we specfify if we suppose them to be identically distributed or to belong to
L p
for
> p 2

X

Math.text: sigma * X = square-root@(Var * X) = square-root@(E * (absolute-value@(X - E * X)) ^ 2)

We say that a sequence of random variables
X n
satisfies the Feller condition when

Math.text: (limit _ (n to infinity))@((maximum _ (1 less= j less= n))@(sigma _ j / s _ n)) = 0

where

We prove that if a sequence satisfies the Lindeberg condition then it satisfies the Feller condition. 5 footnote 5 5 footnote 5 Heinz Bauer, Probability Theory, p. 235, Lemma 28.2.

If a sequence of random variables
X n
satisfies the Lindeberg condition, then it satisfies the Feller condition.

> ϵ 0

absent = epsilon ^ 2 * (s _ n) ^ 2 + (s _ n) ^ 2 * L _ n * epsilon
absent = epsilon ^ 2 * (s _ n) ^ 2 + (s _ n) ^ 2 * L _ n * epsilon

> ϵ 0

Math.text: absolute-value@(phi _ (list@(n, j)) * x - 1) = absolute-value@((integral _ R)@((e ^ (i * x * y) - 1) * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y))
absolute-value@(phi _ (list@(n, j)) * x - 1)
absent = absolute-value@((integral _ R)@((e ^ (i * x * y) - 1) * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y))

absent less= (integral _ (absolute-value@(y) less epsilon))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (i * x * y) - 1) * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y) + (integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= epsilon))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (i * x * y) - 1) * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y)

para.p: Hence

Using that the family
X
n , j
is asymptotically negligible,

Math.text: (limit-supremum _ (n to infinity))@((maximum _ (1 less= j less= k _ n))@(absolute-value@(phi _ (list@(n, j)) * x - 1))) less= 2 * epsilon * absolute-value@(x)

para.p:
But this is true for all
> ϵ 0
, so

Math.text: (limit-supremum _ (n to infinity))@((maximum _ (1 less= j less= k _ n))@(absolute-value@(phi _ (list@(n, j)) * x - 1))) = 0

para.p: proving the claim. ∎
We now prove the Lindeberg central limit theorem. 8 footnote 8 8 footnote 8 Heinz Bauer, Probability Theory, p. 235, Theorem 28.3.

If
X n
is a sequence of independent
L 2
random variables that satisfy the Lindeberg condition, then

Math.text: S _ n _ * * P to gamma _ 1

para.p: where

Math.text: S _ n = (1 / s _ n) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(X _ j - eta _ j) = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(X _ j - E * X _ j) / (sigma * (X _ 1 + cdots + X _ n))

para.p:
The sequence
=
Y n

=

(

)
0
, i.e.
=
η n
0
.

For
≥ n 1
and
1 ≤ j ≤ n

Math.text: formulae@(mu _ (list@(n, j)) = list@((X _ j / s _ n) _ * * P, [and]), tau _ (list@(n, j)) = sigma _ j / s _ n)

n , j

para.p:

Math.text: (tilde@(gamma)) _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * x = exponential@(- ((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 / 2) * x ^ 2) = (1 - ((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 / 2) * x ^ 2) + (1 / 2) * psi _ (list@(n, j)) * x * x ^ 2

para.p: with, from the above,

Math.text: absolute-value@(psi _ (list@(n, j)) * x) less= epsilon * (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 + 2 * (integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2))) * x)

para.p:
In particular, for all
∈ x R
,

Math.text: (tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)) * x - (tilde@(gamma)) _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * x = (x ^ 2 / 2) * (theta _ (list@(n, j)) * x - psi _ (list@(n, j)) * x)

para.p:
Because the
X n
are independent, the distribution of
is the convolution of the distributions of the summands:

Math.text: mu _ (list@(n, 1)) * cdots * mu _ (list@(n, n))

para.p: whose characteristic function is

Math.text: phi _ n = ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)))

para.p:
since the characteristic function of a convolution of measures is the product of the characteristic functions of the measures. Using
=

Math.text: absolute-value@(phi _ n * x - e ^ (- x ^ 2 / 2)) = absolute-value@(((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)) * x) - ((product _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(e ^ (- (1 / 2) * (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * x ^ 2)))

absent less= ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(absolute-value@((tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)) * x - e ^ (- (1 / 2) * (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * x ^ 2)))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(absolute-value@((tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)) * x - (tilde@(gamma)) _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * x))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(absolute-value@((tilde@(mu)) _ (list@(n, j)) * x - (tilde@(gamma)) _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * x))
absent = (x ^ 2 / 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(absolute-value@(theta _ (list@(n, j)) * x - psi _ (list@(n, j)) * x))
absent = (x ^ 2 / 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@(absolute-value@(theta _ (list@(n, j)) * x - psi _ (list@(n, j)) * x))

para.p:
Therefore, for

para.p: We calculate

Math.text: L _ n * delta = (1 / (s _ n) ^ 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta * s _ n))@(y ^ 2 * d * X _ j _ * * P * y))
L _ n * delta
absent = (1 / (s _ n) ^ 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta * s _ n))@(y ^ 2 * d * X _ j _ * * P * y))
absent = (1 / (s _ n) ^ 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(X _ j) >= delta * s _ n))@((X _ j) ^ 2 * differential-d@(P)))
absent = (1 / (s _ n) ^ 2) * ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(X _ j) >= delta * s _ n))@((X _ j) ^ 2 * differential-d@(P)))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(X _ j / s _ n) >= delta))@((X _ j / s _ n) ^ 2 * differential-d@(P)))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(X _ j / s _ n) >= delta))@((X _ j / s _ n) ^ 2 * differential-d@(P)))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * d * (X _ j / s _ n) _ * * P * y))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * d * (X _ j / s _ n) _ * * P * y))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(mu _ (list@(n, j))) * y))

para.p:
Hence, the fact that the
X n
satisfy the Lindeberg condition yields

Math.text: (limit-supremum _ (n to infinity))@(absolute-value@(phi _ n * x - e ^ (- x ^ 2 / 2))) less= epsilon * x ^ 2 + x ^ 2 * (limit-supremum _ (n to infinity))@(((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2))) * y)))

para.p: Write

Math.text: alpha _ n = (maximum _ (1 less= j less= n))@(tau _ (list@(n, j))) = (maximum _ (1 less= j less= n))@(sigma _ j / s _ n)

para.p: We calculate

Math.text: ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2))) * y)) = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * (1 / (tau _ (list@(n, j)) * square-root@(2 * pi))) * exponential@(- y ^ 2 / (2 * (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y)))
((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2))) * y))

absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((integral _ (absolute-value@(y) >= delta))@(y ^ 2 * (1 / (tau _ (list@(n, j)) * square-root@(2 * pi))) * exponential@(- y ^ 2 / (2 * (tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y)))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / tau _ (list@(n, j))))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u))
absent = ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / tau _ (list@(n, j))))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u))
absent less= ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / alpha _ n))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u))
absent less= ((sum _ (j = 1)) ^ n)@((tau _ (list@(n, j))) ^ 2 * (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / alpha _ n))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u))
absent = (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / alpha _ n))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u)
absent = (integral _ (absolute-value@(u) >= delta / alpha _ n))@(u ^ 2 * differential-d@(gamma _ (list@(0, 1))) * u)

as
